column2: DESCRIPTION Karadi Path Education Company is looking to recruit  Trainer and Product Specialists  for its Karadi Path programs. The incumbent will be required to train teachers/facilitators in the Karadi Path methodology and participate in product evolution and pedagogy development processes. RESPONSIBILITIES Deliver training on the Karadi Path English program delivery and methodology to the teachers of schools that have adopted the program.  Conduct regular support visits to the assigned schools, monitor sessions, and provide feedback for improvement to the government/school management.  Manage the school's delivery and effectiveness of the Karadi Path program in the geography assigned and ensure positive feedback.  Build relationships and maintain good rapport with the government department and functionaries.  Generate timely project reports and documents, ensuring effective communication between the company and the respective government or school partner(s). Qualification: Excellent communication and presentation skills. Strong fluency in English and regional language. Experience in project management and coordination is preferred.  Due to the nature of the work, the applicant must be willing to travel extensively. The applicant must have a 2-wheeler. The cost of travel and accommodation will be reimbursed as per the companys HR and Finance policy.  KPEC is a fast-growing social enterprise and candidates who demonstrate passion and capabilities can expect substantial growth opportunities.  If interested share your CV to dhana.l@karadipath.com

column2: What are we looking for We are searching for innovative, energetic private tutors to join our excellent team of tutors teaching international students (UK). Should have used any software or online tools to enhance English instructions. Teach English to Children in classes 1 to 12 and GCSE level. Skills and Qualifications A thorough understanding of English concepts up to the high school level. Strong verbal as well as written English communication skills. Basic computer skills and the patience to teach children online. A strong desire to help children cultivate their skills and develop their potential. Knowledge of online tools/computers is mandatory. Minimum three years of experience in teaching English. Ensure that all lessons are planned with clear aims and objectives. Roles and Responsibilities Responsibilities include clearing the students doubt as and when they raise them during a class. Monitor students and intervene if they are stuck in a lesson or have a problem. Create and review English content when required.  Desired Candidate Profile   The candidate should have a minimum of 3 years of experience. (International experience preferred) Must have excellent knowledge of the subject to be taught. Willing to work rotational shifts or full-time.  Emotional intelligence. Ability to teach and understand children. Key Skills Required: Must be comfortable teaching  up to 12th grade. Excellent English communication skills (speaking/reading/writing/listening) Experience in teaching/tutoring (ideally working with children). Knowledge of computers is mandatory. Experience in Online Tutoring will be preferred. Qualification: B.A/M.A (with English as a subject in graduation/post-graduation), Two Years of school teaching experience. column2: Dear Candidate, Location: Bidadi  Skills:  1. Excellent communication skills - Written and Verbal  2. Familiar with local language  Age no bar - Retired Teachers / other professions who can teach English to students can apply for this role. Duration 3 months  Company Overview: [24]7.ai Foundation is committed to making a positive impact on society through our Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) initiatives. As part of our commitment, we are seeking a dedicated and passionate individual to join us as an English Language and Job Preparation Trainer. This role will play a crucial part in empowering individuals with the necessary skills and knowledge to enhance their employment prospects and contribute to their personal and professional development. Job Description:  As an English Language and Job Preparation Trainer, you will be responsible for delivering high-quality training programs to individuals seeking to improve their language proficiency and enhance their job readiness skills. Your primary focus will be on equipping participants with the linguistic abilities and job-related competencies needed to succeed in the workforce. Key Responsibilities: Implement comprehensive training curricula aimed at improving participants' English language proficiency. Conduct engaging and interactive training sessions covering various aspects of English grammar, vocabulary, reading, writing, listening, and speaking skills. Provide guidance and support to participants in preparing for job interviews, writing resumes, and enhancing employability skills such as communication, teamwork, and problem-solving. Utilize innovative teaching methodologies and technology tools to enhance the effectiveness of training delivery. Monitor and evaluate participants' progress, provide constructive feedback, and adjust training approaches as necessary to ensure desired learning outcomes. Collaborate with other trainers and stakeholders to continuously improve training programs and resources. Maintain accurate records of attendance, assessments, and training activities. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in English language, Education, Linguistics, or a related field. Proven experience in teaching English as a second language, preferably in a vocational training or educational setting. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work effectively with individuals from diverse backgrounds and cultures. Demonstrated passion for education, community development, and social impact. Certification in English language teaching (e.g., TEFL, TESOL) is a plus. Join us in making a meaningful impact through education and empowerment. Apply now to become part of our dedicated team of trainers committed to transforming lives and building brighter futures.

column2: Lesson Planning and Delivery : Plan and deliver engaging lessons that cover the required curriculum content, ensuring that it is accessible and challenging for students of varying abilities. Curriculum Development : Contribute to the development and refinement of the physics curriculum, aligning it with educational standards and incorporating best practices in teaching and learning. Classroom Management : Maintain a positive and orderly learning environment conducive to academic growth, managing student behavior effectively and fostering mutual respect. Assessment and Evaluation : Design and administer assessments to evaluate student understanding and progress, providing timely feedback to students and parents/guardians. Differentiated Instruction : Differentiate instruction to meet the diverse needs of students, incorporating various teaching strategies and resources to accommodate different learning styles and abilities. Laboratory Supervision : Oversee laboratory activities, ensuring safety protocols are followed and providing guidance to students as they conduct experiments to reinforce theoretical concepts. Integration of Technology : Integrate technology into teaching practices, utilizing multimedia resources, simulations, and educational software to enhance student engagement and understanding. Collaboration : Collaborate with colleagues, administrators, and other stakeholders to support the overall educational goals of the school, participate in professional development activities, and contribute to a collaborative professional learning community. Parent/Guardian Communication : Maintain open and effective communication with parents/guardians regarding student progress, academic concerns, and opportunities for enrichment or intervention. Extracurricular Involvement : Participate in extracurricular activities such as science fairs, clubs, and competitions to provide additional opportunities for student involvement and enrichment in physics-related activities. Professional Growth : Engage in ongoing professional development to stay abreast of developments in the field of physics education, refine teaching practices, and enhance subject matter expertise. Cultural Competence : Foster a culturally responsive learning environment that respects and celebrates the diversity of students, incorporating culturally relevant examples and perspectives into instruction. Support for Students : Provide academic support and guidance to students outside of regular class time through tutoring, mentoring, and academic advising, as needed. Advocacy : Advocate for the importance of physics education and STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) literacy within the school community and beyond. Ethical Conduct : Uphold high ethical standards in all aspects of teaching, demonstrating integrity, fairness, and professionalism in interactions with students, colleagues, and parents/guardians.

column2: City Montessori School is looking for Junior English Teacher to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey         Curriculum Development    : Junior English Teachers design lesson plans and instructional materials that align with curriculum standards and objectives. They create engaging activities and projects to help students develop their reading, writing, speaking, and listening skills.            Classroom Instruction    : They deliver lessons in English language arts, which may include literature analysis, grammar instruction, vocabulary building, writing workshops, and oral presentations. They employ a variety of teaching strategies to accommodate different learning styles and abilities.            Assessment and Evaluation    : Junior English Teachers assess student progress through quizzes, tests, essays, projects, and other forms of evaluation. They provide constructive feedback to students to help them improve their language skills and comprehension.            Classroom Management    : They maintain a positive and inclusive classroom environment conducive to learning. Junior English Teachers establish and enforce rules and routines, manage student behavior, and promote respect and cooperation among students.            Differentiation    : They differentiate instruction to meet the diverse needs of students, including those with learning disabilities, English language learners, and gifted learners. They may adapt materials, modify assignments, and provide extra support or enrichment as needed.            Parent and Community Engagement    : Junior English Teachers communicate regularly with parents and guardians to discuss student progress, address concerns, and solicit feedback. They may also participate in parent-teacher conferences, open houses, and other school events.            Professional Development    : They engage in ongoing professional development to stay current with best practices in English language teaching, educational technology, literacy instruction, and classroom management techniques.
